result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall L. Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have contact with Ruth Haper, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION AS OF PROBATION REVIEW HEARING ON 12/10/15.  AS AN ATR EFFECTIVE 11/12/15, WHICH WILL ALLOW DEFT TIME TO COMPLETE THE LIVING FREE PROGRAM.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge
2 years WSP; 18 Mo Initial followed by 6 months ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

State of Wisconsin appears by District Attorney Michael Graveley.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP forthwith; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision.  Credit for 438 days.  Sentence is concurrent with 15CM173.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Unpaid costs and surcharges continued as previously ordered and to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid costs remaining upon discharge; civil judgment to be entered.

As an ATR 1 yr KCJ effective 11/12/15, which will allow deft time to complete the Living Free program.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Probation agent Debra Adams appeared by phone.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. is in custody on a probation hold.  Def. has agreed to an alternative to revocation which includes serving one year in Co. Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.   Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.   Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions Concurrent to 15CM173.  See conditions.  No contact with Ruth H. unless permitted by the court only.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
